resources: SignLearn Game Lesson Translator Topic /Curriculum Section //main Definition : //adverb.yes Yes> Used to give a positive answer or reply to a question, request, or offer; used to give an affirmative response. //adverb.no No Used to give a negative response; the opposite of yes. The movement is sometimes once, sometimes twice, sometimes plural, depending on the contexts. > //alphabets.A A The first letter of the English alphabet, a vowel. Not to be confused with the letter "S". The thumb should be on the outside, not on the closed fingers. //alphabets.B B The second letter of the English alphabet, a consonant. //alphabets.C C The third letter of the English alphabet, a consonant. //alphabets.Y Y The 25th letter of the English alphabet, a consonant. //attachments.like Like Other similar words such as good, approve, etc. The hand is showing a thumbs up. //attachments.dislike Dislike Other similar words such as bad, disapprove, etc. The hand is showing a thumbs down. //attachments.iloveyou I Love You It is used to, often informally, express "I love you" among family members, as well as sometimes among very close friends, whenever appropriate. //numbers.num1 1 (One) The lowest cardinal number; half of two; the numeral symbol of 1. Palm in for the cardinal number. Note, palm out for age, address, phone number, and some others. //numbers.num2 2 (Two) Equivalent to the sum of one and one; one less than three; a symbol for this number as 2 or II. The orientation of the palm faces the signer for a number, but faces the listener for two o clock and age. //numbers.num3 10 (Ten) The number ten. The palm facing the signer is generally used in cardinal number. //pronouns.me I (Me) The ASL signs/words "I" and "me" are the same. It is a pronoun. The object or subject of the pronoun can be identified in sentence structure. //pronouns.you You The pronoun of the second person singular, used of the person being addressed.
